results.title: Sunday in the park with George
results.creator_credit: Terry Hughes, Iris Merlis, American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Brandman Productions, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman and Schubert Organization
results.brief_description: A musical interpretation of George Seurat’s painting “A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte” based loosely on Seurat’s life and book by James Lapine. Music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim, musical director and conductor, Paul Gemignani - originally directed for the Broadway stage by James Lapine. Cast also includes Charles Kimbrough, Barbara Bryne, Dana Ivey, Mary D’arcy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Hughes, Iris Merlis, American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Brandman Productions, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman and Schubert Organization

Cast also includes Charles Kimbrough, Barbara Bryne, Dana Ivey, Mary D’arcy.

Cast also includes Charles Kimbrough, Barbara Bryne, Dana Ivey, Mary D’arcy.

results.title: Video and Animation Workshops 2006
results.brief_description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.
results.description: A selection of video and animated works created by young students from different schools in various ACMI Workshops during 2006, including “Scratch it”, “Digital Poetry”, and “Claymation”. Also includes two untitled abstract animated works.

results.title: Super Penguin
results.brief_description: A short film made in a one-day ACMI Claymation workshop where students are taught the basics of stop motion animation using modelling clay, a digital video camera and editing software. They also create an original soundtrack for their film

results.title: Sunbury
results.creator_credit: John Dixon and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: The Sunbury Music Festival, held each Australia Day between 1972 and 1975 holds fond memories for the 35,000 plus people who attended. This video shows highlights of the first festival in 1972 and captures the excitement of a festival which showcased Australian Rock music and provides a document of Australian society in the seventies.
